intro: Lotus corniculatus var. versicolor, commonly known as the variable horned poppy, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its delicate, papery petals that range in color from white to pink and red, depending on the variety. The plant typically grows in open grasslands and disturbed soils, thriving in full sun. Its seed pods are elongated and horn-like, giving it the common name "horned poppy." The flowers bloom in early summer, adding a vibrant splash of color to its natural habitat.
